doc.previous: A safari from a Swahili word meaning a long journey especially in Africa is defined as an overland journey
doc.after: Safari as a distinctive way of hunting was popularised by the US author Ernest Hemingway and President Theodore Roosevelt A safari may consist of a several days or even weeks long journey with camping in the bush or jungle while pursuing big game Nowadays it is often used to describe tours through African national parks to watch or hunt wildlife
